;一条繁忙道路上的巨大建筑梁倒塌，造成至少一人死亡警方周一表示，泰国首都曼谷发生了一起恐怖事件，该恐怖事件的视频在网上迅速传播。周一下午，让行人和司机措手不及。

;

;这是修建高架公路项目的一部分，旨在缓解该市臭名昭著的交通拥堵。

;

;在在国家防灾减灾部门的报告中，连接到高速公路未完工部分的巨大金属平台摇晃起来，然后坠落到地面。

;

;警方称，至少一人死亡，多达八人受伤.

;

;“我们还不知道事故发生的原因，”曼谷市长 Chadchart Sittipunt 周一晚间在现场告诉记者。

;

;“我们还没有任何有关失踪人员的信息。 ，”他说，并补充说，其中四名伤者伤势严重。

;

;Chadchart 表示，救援人员将等待工程师对倒塌情况进行分析，然后再开始行动。

;

;“我们将安全放在第一位。我们将开始仔细搜索。”他说。

;

;假日屠杀再次出现在泰国道路上，三天内有 182 人死亡

;

;一名救援人员在网上分享的一段视频显示了倒塌的后果警笛响起，震惊的居民和旁观者调查受损情况。

;

;被毁坏的大梁以及它所摧毁的大部分在建高速公路都挡住了街道。

;

;救援人员涌向废墟，可以看到被压碎的货车和汽车。夜幕降临，废墟中仍能看到救援人员的身影。

;

;泰国建筑安全记录不佳，事故频发。

;

;2016年，至少有13人死亡。一座建筑在施工过程中塌陷。

;

;该事件再次引起劳工组织的抗议，他们长期以来一直警告泰国建筑工地的安全标准松懈和工资低。

; Tue, 11 Jul 2023 00:20:02 +0800 China inflation: 3 takeaways as deflation risk rose in Junehttps://www.scmp.com/economy/economic-indicators/article/3227199/china-inflation-3-takeaways-deflation-risk-rose-june?utm_source=rss_feed

;

;

;中国居民消费价格指数 (CPI) 与6 月同比增速低于 5 月的 0.2%。

;

;根据中国金融数据提供商 Wind 的数据，这低于 0.1% 的预期涨幅，是 2 月份以来的最低增速2021年。

;

;北京设定2023年CPI增长3%左右的目标。

;

;6月份CPI通胀下降主要是由非食品因素推动的，因为食品价格上涨野村证券(Nomura)分析师表示，通胀已显示出一些企稳迹象。

;

;在CPI中，6月份食品价格同比上涨2.3%，而5月份的涨幅为1%。

;

;与此同时，非食品价格上个月同比下降，继 5 月份持平后下降 0.6%。

;

;中餐主食猪肉价格6月份，同比下降7.2%，水果价格上涨6.4%，蔬菜价格上涨10.8%。

;

;“食品价格涨幅有所回升，但这是凯投宏观(Capital Economics)经济学家表示，核心通胀率从同比0.6%下降至0.4%，燃油价格通胀率降至31个月低点，这足以抵消这一影响。 “前者反映了旅行和其他面对面服务的价格上涨放缓，这扭转了之前由[中国]重新开放推动的价格上涨。”

;

;中国的核心消费者通胀率，不包括波动较大的食品价格6 月份同比增长 0.4%，增幅低于 5 月份的 0.6%。

;

;

;

;中国生产者价格指数 (PPI) 下降 5.4% 6 月同比下降 5 月的 4.6%，连续第九个月处于通缩区域，跌至 2015 年 12 月以来的最低点。

;

;这低于预期，据Wind称，上个月PPI预计将下降5%。

;

;PPI反映了工厂向批发商收取产品的价格。

;

;“6月份PPI通胀下降主要原因是各种国内原材料价格连续下跌，尽管去年的基数比 5 月份低，因为乌克兰危机的初步影响在去年这个时候开始更有意义地缓和。”野村证券 (Nomura) 分析师表示。

;

;出厂价格环比也下降了 0.8%，凯投宏观 (Capital Economics) 经济学家指出，能源、金属和化学品价格降幅最大，消费者消费由于中国国内外需求疲软，耐用品价格也出现回落。

;

;

;

;野村证券分析师预计 7 月份 CPI 通胀率将进一步下滑至 -0.5%，同比下降 5%。部分原因是比较基数较高，即使考虑到暑假期间服务业通胀可能上升。

;

;他们预计 PPI 通胀将同比温和反弹至负 4.5% 7 月份，主要是由于基数较低。

;

;“超低通胀数据支持了我们的观点，即[中国人民银行]可能会再实施两轮政策降息野村证券分析师表示：“每次下调 10 个基点，并在今年剩余时间内将[存款准备金率]再下调 25 个基点。”

;

;央行上次下调存款准备金率是在3月份银行存款准备金下降了25个基点。

;

;6月份，中国人民银行下调了五年期贷款市场报价利率（LPR）——这是抵押贷款的参考利率——从 4.3% 增至 4.2%。一年期贷款优惠利率（企业贷款的中期贷款基准）也从 3.65% 下调至 3.55%。两项主要贷款利率最后一次下调都是在 8 月份。

;

;“生产者价格指数 (PPI) 通货紧缩可能会在下半年有所缓解，部分原因是基础设施支出应该为大宗商品价格提供支撑。凯投宏观经济学家表示，随着相对紧张的劳动力市场给工资带来更大的上行压力，核心通胀可能会逐渐上升。可能会在未来几个月内减弱。因此，我们预计今年年底总体通胀率将升至 1% 左右。

;

;“但这仍将是疲软的，不会限制中国人民银行进一步放松政策的能力。”尽管如此，由于信贷需求疲软且货币面临压力，我们认为大部分支持将来自财政政策。我们预计今年政策利率只会再下调 10 个基点。”

;一项向香港居民每扔一袋垃圾收费的计划推迟到明年，再次推迟了近 20 年前首次提出的城市垃圾管理改革计划。

;

;环境局表示，收费将于 4 月 1 日开始，而不是年底。周一告诉立法者，承认在垃圾收集者对寒假期间垃圾数量预计激增表示担忧后，需要更多时间来制定该计划的后勤工作。

;

;“一些行业，例如清洁服务考虑到圣诞节和农历新年期间预计将产生大量废物，以及农历新年期间人手短缺，该局一直呼吁推迟实施。”该局在提交的文件中表示。

;

;“因此，我们建议于2024年4月1日起实施都市固体废物收费，这标志着香港废物管理的一个重要里程碑。”

;

;平均三件- 假设每个家庭每天产生 13 升垃圾，预计每个家庭每月需支付 33 港元（4.20 美元）购买政府批准的垃圾袋。

;

;但许多居民将幸免于难。该计划前六个月的费用。当局将向105万个居住在公屋、乡郊及没有业主立案法团的住宅小区的家庭派发20袋15公升的物品。

;

;房委会则协助派发至公屋住户方面，该局尚未与民政事务总署敲定其他受免费垃圾袋计划覆盖的家庭将如何接收这些垃圾。

;

;将在乡郊地区设立更多垃圾收集点，并设立大型垃圾收集箱设立在免费袋子计划覆盖的私人住宅小区附近。

;

;每个袋子售价为11港仙，六个月后，居民如使用非政府指定的袋子，将面临1,500港元的罚款。无法放入垃圾袋的大型废物需要贴上特殊标签，费用为港币11元。

;

;“相关废物接收点的前线工作人员会目视检查交给他们的废物是否已妥善包装。环保局表示，将拒绝任何不合规废物。

;

;14年后，香港将强制实施废物收费计划

;

;“针对严重黑点

;

;政府亦会向每名综合社会保障援助受助人或综合社会保障援助受助人提供每月港币 10 元的资助。老年生活津贴。

;

;当局目前正在建立一个由超市、便利店、药店、家居用品店和在线平台组成的全市网络，以方便购买这些包。

;

;环境生态局表示，当局已收到 19 家零售连锁店和网上零售商出售这些袋子和标签的要求，覆盖 2,000 个网点和 11 个数字平台。

;

;在 2021 年发布的《香港 2035 年废物蓝图》中，政府制定了计划，逐步将人均处理率降低45%，并将回收率提高到55%左右。

;

;415万吨市政垃圾中，只有30%左右2021 年城市处理的固体废物得到回收，其余的则送往垃圾填埋场。

;

;台北自 2000 年起开始对城市垃圾收费，首尔自 1995 年起开始收费。两者的垃圾量均减少了至少 30% .

;

;香港“应将废物收费计划推迟到春季，以防止垃圾堆积”

;

;香港征收垃圾税的想法于 2004 年首次提出，当时政府详细阐述了未来十年将如何处理废物。

;

;时任行政长官曾荫权的政府提议利用经济激励措施鼓励居民多回收、少处置。

;

;随后的主管部门采纳了对处置收费的想法。一项法案于 2018 年起草，并于 2021 年由立法者通过，但当局有 18 个月的时间来准备这一转变。

;

;该计划原定于今年年底生效，但上周代表们表示垃圾收集部门警告说，香港在寒假期间扔出的垃圾将超出其处理能力。

;

;香港“应将垃圾收费计划推迟到春季，以防止垃圾堆积”

;

;代表七个商业集团和约 200 家清洁服务公司的环境服务承包商联盟称推迟对行业来说是个好消息。

;

;“现在是行业学习新知识的理想时机。劳动力最充裕时的废物管理模式，”联盟发言人邱佩林说。 “垃圾量在10月至3月期间达到峰值，但在4月至6月期间达到最低点。”

;

;他还呼吁当局举办更多研讨会，以便业界更好地了解新系统。

;< p>;但环保组织绿领行动的高级公共事务官员Beatrice Siu Wing-yin对这一拖延表示失望。

;

;“我们已经讨论垃圾税十多年了，”她说。 “香港平均每日废物处置量已达11,300吨。如果当局再拖下去，每天的处理量还会继续增加。”

;香港律政司司长向警方提出针对两名反对派维权律师的专业不当行为投诉因涉嫌危害国家安全罪被列入通缉名单。

;

;律政司司长林定国举报大律师兼前立法会议员郭永亨和律师任建峰涉嫌涉嫌犯有国家安全罪。损害了律师行业的声誉，削弱了外界对香港法治的信心。

;

;“他们利用大律师、律师的身份，意图增加自己的公信力和权威，抹黑律师。”林郑月娥周一表示，“破坏香港的司法制度和法治，诽谤香港法官和检察官，推动和支持外国势力对中国和香港特别是香港法官和检察官实施制裁”。

;<他们的行为损害了香港的司法制度和整体利益，也违反了大律师和律师的基本行为准则……作为公众利益的保护者，我必须维护香港的法治和正义。 ”

;

;这两人是被通缉的八人之一，被悬赏 100 万港元（127,725 美元），被指控违反北京 2020 年实施的国家安全法，该法旨在惩罚分裂国家行为，

;

;林郑月娥还指责任和郭对香港司法系统进行毫无根据的指控。

;

;“郭甚至主张破坏香港金融体系，林说，“他们试图干涉法官处理国家安全案件。”林说。

;

;“而任则煽动和支持制裁法官和检察官，并支持制裁他们的家人，以胁迫他们。这种行为是公开践踏正义。”

;

;8 香港通缉活动人士应被视为“街上的老鼠”：李约翰

;

;任志强，于 2022 年移居澳大利亚据称，他去年曾会见海外官员，要求对香港政府实施制裁。

;

;据称，他还曾于5月份要求外国政府对香港法官和检察官实施处罚。

;

; >;

;郭先生是前反对派议员，于 2020 年前往加拿大，涉嫌支持 2021 年针对中国大陆和香港实施制裁和其他敌对行动的呼吁。

;

;据称，他曾去年再次呼吁对香港进行经济制裁。

;

;律师管理机构香港律师会表示无法对个别案件发表评论。

;

;但它证实该协会周一收到针对一名会员的专业不当行为投诉。

;

;奖励纠纷不应阻止香港讲述其好故事

;

;该协会主席陈泽明表示： “我想强调……律师会非常重视我们会员的行为……并严格处理所有投诉，并以公平、公正和客观的方式处理。”

;

;律师公会监管大律师的机构已被要求置评。

;

;这两个专业团体上周表示，他们已收到有关成员因涉嫌违反国家安全法而被警方通缉的投诉。

;

;香港警方上周一宣布悬赏 100 万港元，以提供线索逮捕这八人，他们都在海外。

;

;其他人是前立法会议员罗冠聪和许志峰，工会成员蒙少达和活动人士刘祖迪、郭凤仪和袁恭仪。

;

;其中一名通缉犯居住在美国，称此举威胁人民的人权和自由。

; Mon, 10 Jul 2023 23:20:02 +0800 Ant Group’s IPO plan under the spotlight after regulatory fine, share buy-backhttps://www.scmp.com/tech/big-tech/article/3227211/ant-groups-ipo-plan-under-spotlight-after-regulatory-fine-share-buy-back?utm_source=rss_feed

;亿万富翁杰克创立的金融科技巨头蚂蚁集团的上市计划和修订后的估值在北京以近 10 亿美元的罚款结束了为期两年半的监管调查后，马云成为了人们关注的焦点。

;

;尽管蚂蚁金服对恢复计划守口如瓶，在马云在2020年底发表批评中国金融监管的有争议的演讲后，蚂蚁金服的上市在最后一刻被取消，北京方面承诺对蚂蚁金服和其他金融科技公司进行“常态化”管理，引发了蚂蚁金服IPO障碍已被解除的猜测

;

;“打击行动结束后，蚂蚁金服可能会重新考虑上市计划，”IPG中国首席经济学家白文曦表示。

;

;不过，即使蚂蚁金服重回上市轨道，如果在香港或上海上市，其估值将显着低于 2020 年 10 月，当时阿里巴巴集团控股分拆公司的目标是 370 亿美元 IPO，预计估值为 3000 亿美元。

;

;阿里巴巴物流部门推出快递服务，提高电商效率

;

;在最新的回购股份计划中，蚂蚁金服的发行价较其总股本高达7.6%折让近75%。估值3000亿美元。拥有《南华早报》并持有蚂蚁金服 33% 股权的阿里巴巴表示，正在考虑是否参与回购计划。

;

;与此同时，蚂蚁金服的金融科技业务以及蚂蚁金服等竞争对手腾讯控股的金融科技部门受到更严格的监管，这使得发展利润丰厚的信贷业务和赚取高利润变得更加困难。蚂蚁金服也在数据共享、管理和人员等方面与阿里巴巴渐行渐远，以符合北京的要求。

;

;“蚂蚁金服和腾讯的金融科技业务似乎有可能分别在资本市场上市上海协赢律师事务所证券律师董约翰表示。

;

;马云在 2023 年初宣布的公司重组中放弃了对蚂蚁金服的最终控制权，结束了代理蚂蚁金服的行为。与公司董事长井贤栋、前首席执行官胡晓明和阿里巴巴集团资深人士蒋芳签署一致协议。蚂蚁集团 1 月份表示，此次重组意味着马云放弃了 53.46% 的投票权。

;

;上海汉盛律师事务所高级合伙人李敏表示，此次处罚是“严厉打击

;

;例如，对蚂蚁金服处以的 71.23 亿元人民币（9.8433 亿美元）罚款低于 28 亿美元的反垄断罚款2021 年 4 月，国家市场监管总局对阿里巴巴进行了处罚。

;

;香港九龙东的一个封存的单轨铁路项目吸引了第二家公司的兴趣在中国大陆，几个月前，该市领导人表示，他愿意使用一家电动汽车制造商的公共交通系统来恢复该计划。

;

;中唐高铁集团国际业务部总监 Eleanor Jane Mak 表示周一表示，该市搁置的交通计划引起了这家四川公司的注意。

;

;该公司早些时候与阿拉伯联合酋长国迪拜当局签署了一份谅解备忘录，探讨开发悬挂式单轨铁路网络。

;

;香港在2020年取消了自己建造连接启德、观塘和九龙湾的单轨铁路的计划。当局当时估计该项目将耗资 120 亿港元（15 亿美元），并认为成本太高。

;

;香港领导人对使用大陆制造的交通线路恢复单轨铁路计划持开放态度

;< p>;今年 4 月，行政长官李家超表示，政府对使用深圳比亚迪汽车开发的 SkyShuttle 电动火车系统持开放态度，有关该计划的讨论随后又重新展开。

;

;这一想法是由立法会议员提出的，他们与李光耀和其他高级官员一起进行了为期四天的大湾区之旅，这是北京将香港、澳门和九个内地城市整合为经济强国的雄心勃勃的计划。

;

;立法者张新宇曾估计，在启德安装这条铁路线的成本约为 70 亿港元，即每公里 5 亿港元。

;

;麦周一表示，该公司迄今为止仅派遣工程师前往香港，以解决该问题。

;

;虽然她没有透露中唐愿意为九龙东复兴铁路项目投资多少，但她表示安装轻轨系统的成本在1亿至1亿港元之间。每公里1.5亿港元。

;

;每节火车车厢由三个车厢组成，每小时可搭载10,000至20,000名乘客，高于比亚迪汽车交通系统可运送的6,000至10,000名乘客，她补充道。< /p>;

;中唐的空中列车也依赖于悬挂单轨系统，而SkyShuttle则使用安装在高架轨道上的自动锂动力车辆。

;

;Mak表示，轨道系统上方的表面可能是用作自行车道或留作其他用途。

;

;“我们的系统是模块化构建的，因此可以节省大量劳动力成本，因此我们不需要在香港花费额外的时间和人力从头开始，”她说。 “我们只需要运送它们并组装它们。”

;

;公司代表还与香港路政署会面，并将在未来几个月与其他利益相关者讨论可能的合作领域，她补充道。< /p>;

;为什么香港启德单轨铁路计划需要重启

;

;发展局局长林汉豪上周表示，政府将研究绿色和智能集体交通的最新技术发展运输及物流局亦正在探讨为港铁公司的东九龙线开发高架无轨快速运输系统，作为恢复搁置的单轨计划的一部分。林恩补充说，一项研究将于今年完成，并将考虑居民对铁路可能路线的看法。

;

;《华盛顿邮报》已联系运输和物流部门交通局及路政署征求意见。

;覆盖该国最新航空母舰上先进飞机发射系统部分的避难所出现据军事分析人士称，该舰上的弹射起飞测试已被删除，这表明该舰的弹射起飞测试可能很快就会开始。

;

;一位军事爱好者周一在微博（相当于中国的推特）上发布的照片​​也显示了一系列台湾海军学院前教官卢立时表示，电磁弹射系统的安装已于几个月前完成，

;

;“下一步应该是对歼15T战斗机进行测试。”

;

;他还表示，舰上的雷达系统照片中包括先进的有源电子扫描阵列（AESA）。

;

;“这与055型巡洋舰和052D型驱逐舰上使用的相同，这意味着海试可能随时开始，”陆说。< /p>;

;J-15T 是 J-15 战斗机的更新版本，并配备了新的弹射系统。

;

;该飞机是该国唯一现役舰载机战斗机，并已部署在中国另外两艘航母辽宁舰和山东舰上。

;

;自 2021 年该飞机的照片开始在中国社交媒体平台上流传以来，军事爱好者一直关注 J-15T 的发展。

;

;据了解，J-15T 的地面飞行测试多年前就在位于辽宁省兴城的中国人民解放军海军训练基地开始。

;

;周晨明，北京远望军事科技智库研究员表示，电磁弹射系统自一年前推出以来，中国工程师不断对其进行修改。

;

;“经过一年多的校准，现在是时候确保歼15T的飞行试验能够在今年年底前完成了。”周说，并补充说时间表可能在8月至10月之间。

;

;“确保安全仍然是首要任务对于如此高度复杂的武器系统来说，这是当务之急，如果到 8 月还没有准备好，那么 [PLA] 可以瞄准 10 月 1 日 [国庆]。”

;

;中国军人傅前哨航空分析师表示，只有福建舰首次海试顺利，歼15T飞行试验才会进行。

;

;福建舰是中国第三艘航母，也是迄今为止最先进的航母。卢表示，如果美国干预台湾问题的冲突，预计它将在解放军的反介入和区域拒止战略中发挥关键作用。

;

;北京将台湾视为中国的一部分，并已不排除使用武力将其收回。包括美国在内的大多数国家都不承认台湾是一个独立国家，但反对使用武力改变现状。

;

;陆说，福建事件的进展可能表明解放军正在加紧努力到2027年建军一百周年，实现“全面现代化军队”的短期目标。

;

;另外两个目标是到2035年完成军队现代化，成为“世界一流”军队到本世纪中叶，军事力量将与美国平起平坐。

;

;福建号是中国人民解放军海军 003 型航母中的第一艘，也是继美国杰拉尔德·福特级之后唯一的第二艘航母级航母。使用电磁弹射系统从甲板上发射飞机。

;

;预计它将成为中国成为一支能够在远海作战的蓝水海军计划的核心。

; Mon, 10 Jul 2023 22:50:01 +0800 Was China’s ‘rainbow reception’ for Janet Yellen warmer than Antony Blinken’s ‘snub’?https://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3227203/was-chinas-rainbow-reception-janet-yellen-warmer-antony-blinkens-snub?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.10 22:00;
;;

;美国财长耶伦访华时没有走红地毯，但对许多人来说，与几周前访问中国的同事、美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯相比，她确实受到了非常热烈的欢迎。

;

;在为期四天的访问中，耶伦可以说是最鸽派的拜登政府官员会见了许多高级经济和金融官员，包括中国国务院总理李强、财政部长刘昆、央行行长易纲和副总理何立峰。

;

;美中经济竞争不存在耶伦称“赢家通吃”

;

;她还会见了退休的经济重量级人物刘鹤，但没有见到正在江苏视察的习近平。

;

;耶伦在紧张的日程中举行的高层接待被视为一个信号，表明尽管台湾、乌克兰战争和美国主导的技术限制等多条战线的摩擦不断加剧，中国仍决心稳定双边关系并深化合作。

;

;周五，当耶伦在北京走下飞机时，中国财政部代表杨英明在机场迎接她，杨英明微笑着指着彩虹与她握手了约 20 秒。

;

;在与总理会面时再次提到这个天象，总理告诉耶伦：“我认为这也适用于美中关系：经历一轮风雨后，我们一定能看到彩虹。” ”

;

;Video clips of the meetings from Chinese media showed Yellen sitting beside Li and opposite He.

;

;Three weeks earlier, Blinken – who did meet Xi – was shown seated on one side of two long tables taking notes while Xi gave a speech at the head of a table.

;

;The images were in contrast to a meeting three days earlier between Xi and Bill Gates, Microsoft's co-founder. Both men were shown sitting side by side with Xi occasionally leaning in towards Gates. Xi called Gates “an old friend” – a diplomatic term reserved for foreign entities who are seen as having contributed to China's development.

;

;Across Chinese social media platforms, online users seemed generally satisfied with Yellen's visit. Some compared it with Blinken's reception, and observed that the protocols were similar, with no red carpets or flowers.

;

;Many considered the friendly “rainbow reception” at the airport, Yellen's dinner with Chinese women economists, and meetings with senior officials as “high-level receptions” and therefore hopeful signs of improvements in bilateral ties.

;

;“We are quite sincere. This time Yellen came, and we received her 'beyond the standard',” wrote one Weibo user, who argued that US demands should not be overbearing and unacceptable for the Chinese people. The post received thousands of likes on China's Twitter-like platform.

;

;Amid clouds of uncertainty, China welcomes US treasury chief with a rainbow

;

;When she was secretary of state, Hillary Clinton was welcomed to China with a red carpet. Western observers called the protocol to receive Blinken – who was greeted by a mid-level official, without flowers or a red carpet – a plan by Beijing to “humiliate” Blinken as part of its “diplomatic snub”.

;

;But the welcome for Blinken was not a total break from past receptions.

;

;The protocol – and even the conference room – was the same when then US trade representative Robert Lighthizer and then treasury secretary Steven Mnuchin visited China in February 2019, when they met Xi for economic and trade consultations.

;

;Past meetings have been more relaxed. In 2013, days after Xi became China's president, Xi met then US treasury secretary Jacob Lew at the Great Hall of the People. It was Lew's first trip abroad in the role. State media showed the men chatting while sitting in armchairs with a flower basket in between them.

; Mon, 10 Jul 2023 22:20:02 +0800 Tencent’s WeChat to skip Australian social media hearing on ‘political interference’ amid backlashhttps://www.scmp.com/tech/tech-war/article/3227207/tencents-wechat-skip-australian-social-media-hearing-political-interference-amid-backlash?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.10 22:00;
;;

;Chinese social media app WeChat will not be sending a delegate to a hearing at Australia's parliament on foreign interference in domestic political affairs, as a backlash continues to mount in the country against the super app owned by Tencent Holdings.

;

;According to a letter penned by Australian Liberal Senator James Paterson, a prominent China hawk who has warned against WeChat's influence in the country, the Chinese social media platform has declined multiple invitations to appear before the hearing by Australia's Senate Select Committee on Foreign Interference through Social Media, which begins on Tuesday.

;

;The hearing, which is set to highlight the potential of “foreign interference” through social media in Australian politics, will be attended by executives from social media giants TikTok, which is owned by Beijing-based ByteDance, as well as Western platforms Twitter and LinkedIn.

;

;As WeChat has no permanent staff in Australia, the country's parliament cannot force executives from the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen, where Tencent is headquartered, to show up at the hearing.

;

;Tencent apologises for 'misunderstandings' on higher WeChat Pay fees in colleges

;

;“WeChat takes compliance seriously in all markets in which we operate. We look forward to continuing to engage with stakeholders in Australia,” said a Tencent spokesperson on Monday.

;

;WeChat has been under fire in Australia for its alleged influence over Chinese-Australians. WeChat was the third-most popular social media platform used by Chinese-Australians on a daily basis, behind YouTube and Facebook, according to a survey by Sydney-based think tank Lowy Institute in April.

;

;Around 76 per cent of Australians born in China said that they use WeChat everyday, and the app plays a central role as a source of news for Chinese-Australians, according to those polled.

;

;With 690,000 users in Australia by the end of 2020, WeChat has been a crucial communications tool for Chinese diasporas around the world, who rely on the app to communicate with families and friends.

;

;However, the app's function as a platform for news and opinion pieces has invited scrutiny from Australian politicians, amid souring relations between Beijing and Canberra. WeChat has faced calls for a ban over national security concerns, and government agencies including the Department of Defence have restricted the use of the app by their staff.

;

;WeChat is not the only Chinese app that has raised concerns in Australia. In April Australia announced that it would remove TikTok from all federal government-owned devices, following similar moves by other Western countries in the so-called Five Eyes intelligence-sharing network.

;

;TikTok and WeChat were also the targets of a ban proposed by former US President Donald Trump in 2020, but a WeChat user group sued against the move and succeeded when a court blocked the ban. The order was officially withdrawn by US President Joe Biden in 2021.

;

;WeChat, known as Weixin in China, is a hugely-popular social media tool in China and among overseas Chinese communities, with 1.25 billion monthly active users across the globe, the great majority of which are based in China.

; Mon, 10 Jul 2023 22:20:02 +0800 Surprise move as Erdogan links Sweden’s Nato membership to Turkey’s EU accessionhttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/europe/article/3227222/surprise-move-erdogan-links-swedens-nato-membership-turkeys-eu-accession?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.10 22:04;
;;

;Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan, in an unexpected move, said on Monday that the European Union should open the way for Ankara's accession to the bloc before Turkey's parliament approves Sweden's bid to join the Nato military alliance.

;

;Turkey's bid to join the EU has been frozen for years after membership talks were launched in 2005 under Erdogan's first term as prime minister.

;

;The ties between Ankara and members of the bloc soured several years ago, especially after a 2016 failed coup attempt in Turkey, but have since improved. The bloc depends on the help of Nato ally Ankara, particularly on migration.

;

;In a surprise change of tack, Erdogan on Monday linked Ankara's approval of Sweden's Nato bid to Turkey finally joining the EU.

;

;In call with Turkey's Erdogan, Biden expresses support for Sweden's Nato bid

;

;“I am calling from here on these countries that are making Turkey wait at the door of the European Union for more than 50 years,” Erdogan said, speaking ahead of his departure for the Nato summit in Vilnius.

;

;“First, come and open the way for Turkey at the European Union and then we will open the way for Sweden, just as we did for Finland,” he said, adding that he would repeat his call during the summit.

;

;A European Commission spokesperson said Nato and EU enlargement were “separate processes” and that “The accession process for each candidate country is based on the merits of each country”, adding that the two processes cannot be linked.

;

;Asked about Erdogan's comments, Nato Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said while he backs Ankara's membership of the EU, as far as he was concerned Sweden had already met the conditions required to join Nato.

;

;“It is still possible to have a positive decision on Sweden in Vilnius,” Stoltenberg told a news conference.

;

;Sweden and Finland applied for Nato membership last year, abandoning policies of military non-alignment that had lasted through the decades of the Cold War in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

;

;While Finland's Nato membership was green-lighted in April, Turkey and Hungary have yet to clear Sweden's bid. Stockholm has been working to join the bloc at the summit in Vilnius.

;

;Erdogan said Sweden's accession hinged on the implementation of a deal reached last summer during the alliance's summit in Madrid, adding that no one should expect compromises from Ankara.

;

;Ankara says Sweden has not done enough against people Turkey sees as terrorists, mainly members of the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) that is considered a terrorist organisation by Turkey, the EU and the United States.

;

;No Nato for Sweden if Koran burning is allowed, says Turkey's Erdogan

;

;Sinan Ulgen, former diplomat and director of the Istanbul-based Centre for Economic and Foreign Policy Studies, said Erdogan's move would not strengthen Turkey's hand at the Vilnius summit.

;

;“The positive side of this surprise move is that it showed Turkey still has an EU membership perspective. But it is hard to say it would help any progress on Turkey's EU membership bid,” he said.

;

;Erdogan also said that an end to the war between Ukraine and Russia would ease Kyiv's Nato membership process.

; Mon, 10 Jul 2023 22:20:02 +0800 China’s Xi Jinping pledges economic, tech aid for Solomon Islands as ‘strategic partnership’ takes offhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3227221/chinas-xi-jinping-pledges-economic-tech-aid-solomon-islands-strategic-partnership-takes?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.10 22:12;
;;

;Chinese President Xi Jinping has pledged economic and technological aid with “no political preconditions” for Solomon Islands – Beijing's first close security partner in the strategically important South Pacific.

;

;Meeting Solomons' Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare in Beijing on Monday, Xi said: “Although our friendship arrived belatedly, it has come to the forefront of relations between China and the Pacific Islands.”

;

;“China supports more Chinese enterprises to invest in Solomon Islands and will continue to provide assistance and technologies with no political preconditions,” state broadcaster CCTV quoted Xi as saying.

;

;He said China was willing to share in the development of the Pacific nation and in the opportunities brought by modernisation, “expand cooperation in all sectors … and assist Solomon Islands to revive development and achieve long-term stability”.

;

;Xi and Sogavare also announced the setting up of a “comprehensive strategic partnership” and signed a joint statement for “mutual respect and co-development”.

;

;“Developing diplomatic ties was the right choice … China has become the largest infrastructure partner of Solomon Islands and a reliable partner for development,” CCTV reported Sogavare as saying.

;

;Soon after Solomon Islands switched diplomatic recognition from Taiwan to Beijing four years ago, it joined the Belt and Road Initiative – Beijing's flagship multinational infrastructure strategy under which it offers loans and invests in projects like railways, highways and ports.

;

;Sogavare, who led the switch soon after coming to power in April 2019, will also open his country's embassy in Beijing later this week.

;

;This is Sogavare's second visit to China, but the first since the signing of a landmark bilateral security deal last year that had provoked strong rebukes from the United States and its South Pacific allies, Australia and New Zealand.

;

;He arrived on Sunday for a weeklong, Chinese-funded trip aimed at “further strengthening bilateral ties”, an official statement from his government said.

;

;After meetings with senior officials, Sogavare will visit Chinese enterprises in Beijing and later travel with his delegation to the economically powerful coastal provinces of Jiangsu and Guangdong. Guangdong set up a sister-province relationship with Guadalcanal, an island in the Solomons, in May.

;

;The state visit is also the latest sign of closer bilateral economic and trade cooperation, after last year's security pact paved the way for Chinese police to take an increasing role in training and equipping the Royal Solomon Islands Police Force.

;

;The US and its allies reacted strongly to the deal over concerns about Beijing's naval ambitions in the strategically located region with decades of strong American military presence, especially given the secrecy over the details of the agreement.

;

;The “lack of transparency”, as the US put it, has added to worries that China might be able to station military equipment or personnel, or even set up a military base, in the Pacific Islands.

;

;The China-Solomon Islands security pact and why it has raised alarm

;

;Honiara has sought to dispel those fears, saying last year it would not allow a Chinese military base on its soil and was “conscious of security ramifications”.

;

;Days before Sogavare's trip to China, Australian deputy prime minister and defence minister Richard Marles visited the Solomons for security talks, and emphasised “the deepening partnership between our two countries”.

;

;Australia has been the Solomons' largest aid donor and the two countries also have a decades-old security relationship, including a mechanism for Australian police and defence personnel to deploy rapidly if need be.

;

;China has continued to invest financially in Solomon Islands, prompting the United States to rekindle its engagement with the region, including reopening its embassy in Honiara and boosting investment efforts.

;

;When Sogavare last visited China in October 2019, a month after the switching of ties, state-held China Railway promised help to build facilities for this year's Pacific Games, to be hosted by the Solomons over November and December.

;

;China's Huawei Technologies and contractor China Harbour Engineering are also building 161 mobile telecoms towers in the islands under a deal last year involving a loan of US$66 million from Beijing.
